skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: Official skill source with pre-reviewed guidance and helper scripts. Scanned all text files and found no security concerns in this package.

content.value_statement: Creating skills without structure is slow and inconsistent. This skill provides templates, validation, and packaging guidance to build skills faster.
actual_capabilities: Initialize a new skill folder with a SKILL.md template
Create example scripts, references, and asset placeholders
Validate SKILL.md frontmatter keys, name format, and description length
Package a skill folder into a .skill zip after validation
Provide workflow and output pattern guidance in reference files
limitations: Does not write domain content or real workflows
Validation checks only frontmatter rules, not content quality
Packaging and validation require Python 3 and PyYAML
Does not publish or install skills

use_cases.title: Start a new skill
use_cases.description: Create a clean skill skeleton with required metadata and optional resources.

use_cases.title: Validate submissions
use_cases.description: Run quick checks on SKILL.md metadata before review or release.

use_cases.title: Package for distribution
use_cases.description: Bundle a skill folder into a distributable .skill file.

prompt_templates.title: Create skill skeleton
prompt_templates.scenario: You need a starter skill folder
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new skill named data-cleanup and place it under skills/public. Include default templates and placeholder resources.

prompt_templates.title: Validate metadata
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the skill at skills/public/data-cleanup and report any frontmatter issues.

prompt_templates.title: Package skill file
prompt_templates.prompt: Package the skill at skills/public/data-cleanup into the dist folder.

prompt_templates.title: Refine structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the generated SKILL.md to use a workflow based structure and remove unused resource sections.

output_examples.input: Create a new skill named invoice-helper under skills/private.
output: Added SKILL.md template with required frontmatter
Added example files under scripts, references, and assets

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise and move long details into references
Use clear trigger descriptions and hyphen case names
Validate the skill before packaging or sharing
anti_patterns: Adding extra documentation files outside SKILL.md
Packaging a skill without fixing validation errors
Using vague descriptions that do not state when to use the skill

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides general templates and scripts that work across Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of the validation script?
faq.answer: It only checks frontmatter fields, naming rules, and description length.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into my build pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Run the validation and packaging scripts from your CI workflow.

faq.question: Does it send my data anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All operations run locally on your files.

faq.question: What should I do if validation fails?
faq.answer: Fix the SKILL.md frontmatter keys, name format, or description length, then run validation again.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual setup?
faq.answer: It provides structured templates and automated checks that reduce mistakes and setup time.
